name: Conrad Bangkok Hotel

reviews.text: With all my experience of staying in 5 Star properties, this proved to be the most delightful.
reviews.title: Best Experience ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is centrally located, staff is amicable and Rooms are luxurious. The appearance of room is exotic with addition of Orchids. My Recommendation on Hotel is 10 / 10.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Conrad was fantastic! The room was luxuriously appointed and clean. The hotel staff was extremely polite and helpful. Definitely one of the best hotels I've stayed at. Free internet access in the lobby was a nice perk, although free in-room access would have been nice. I only wished the hotel was closer to the BTS skytrain station.
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel

reviews.text: Excellent choice if you will be out and about in Bangkok and need to stay somewhere that gets things done properly. No complaints.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Bangkok

reviews.text: Great hotel - Great access to the shopping markets! Food is good - The good thing is that Indian food is also available.
reviews.title: Good all rounder

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK so you get the feeling that this it is more of a business hotel but we found it great as tourists too. We loved the location, within walking distance to the night bazaar. But what we loved the most were the luxurious bathrooms complete with floor to ceiling glass (dont worry, there is a curtain that you can pull for privacy when you wish to use the toilet!) so you could bathe with an amazing view over Bangkok. Another plus point was the huge bath with plenty of space for two, which combined with the view made this one of the most romantic hotels that we had ever stayed at! We will definitly be back.
reviews.title: Loved the Conrad!

likes.liked: — Had to be the bath with the view

reviews.text: For $240/night, we had a corner room with a sitting area, 2 poster beds, walk-in closet, and a huge, well-stocked marble bathroom with separate soaking tub and rainshower. It is close to US Embassy, a 10-min walk to night market & SkyTrain station. If you don't want to walk, there's a free shuttle that can take you there. If you like to explore the old Bangkok, you might want to stay elsewhere since the Conrad is a bit inland.
reviews.title: Spacious room, good service.

reviews.text: The Conrad is a great hotel. Elegant without being ostentatious, good for business yet personable, and close to transportation and a few sites, although it is more of the business district. The staff are extremely warm and pleasant, although that is typical of Thai culture. The breakfast is huge, great, and has cuisines of many different cultures. Having the All-Season's mall next door was very convenient -- grocery store, pharmacy, clothing, coffee shops, great Mediterranean restaurant, book and travel stores. Oh, and the pool is great! One drawback and this is quite minor: The wake-up call is a personal call on the speaker-phone on the desk. So, you're woken by a voice talking to you in the room. A bit disconcerting after jetlag, but there are alternate alarms.
reviews.title: Great staff, breakfast
Five stars on every level
reviews.text: My husband and I spent four wonderful days at the Conrad while he was on business in Bangkok. We did receive a favorable government rate, but I would have paid more to stay here. The hotel is located close to the American Embassy and convenient to the Skytrain, although we got around mostly by cabs. (I do NOT recommend a tuk tuk!) The staff in the hotel is simply superb, from the doorman to the massage therapist. I have stayed in numerous five star hotels around the world, and I would rate this hotel in the top 10. Luckily, we were upgraded to a deluxe room because of membership in Hilton Honors, giving us a larger and more luxurious bathroom. The standard rooms are slightly smaller, but all of the rooms have beautiful wood paneling and are decorated in Thai style furnishings. (Our bathroom had a two person soaking tub, a large shower and was beautifully appointed. ) My only complaint was the bed was too hard for my body, although that seems to be the norm for Asia. We did not complain or ask to be moved, but I would have liked a softer, more Western bed. The linens and pillows were luxurious, however.

My two trips to the Seasons Spa were wonderful. My therapist, An (pronounced On), was highly skilled and delivered two totally relaxing massages and one interesting mud treatment. I felt like melted butter when I left the facility. Moreover, the Spa facility is beautifully decorated, with granite walls and lavish treatment rooms. Even the women's locker room adjacent to it is extraordinary! The design of the pool, which is located on the same level, is exceptional -- well thought out and nicely executed. I am a landscape designer and notice such things. It is one of the few pools I have used in a hotel in which you could actually do laps. Also, it is nicely curved providing private places to read or sun at its edges.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

reviews.text: I enjoyed this COnrad enormously. The rooms are excellent, with beautiful bathrooms and standalone tubs, nice glasswindows between bathroon and sleepting area.
reviews.title: Excellent oasis in the middle of Bangkok

reviews.text: Also the pool is super, large and nicely done. The location is in the middle of town yet very quiet and next door to a mall
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay and Would Stay Here Again

reviews.text: The only downside - if any - were the women in the bar that to me looked like prostitues. Unfortunatley, you find them in any Bangkok hotel, also in the highest end hotels
reviews.title: heat and luxury

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Conrad Bangkok which was stellar. Extremely courteous and attentive staff with good English speaking skills. Room was spacious and housekeeping always available if you needed anything. The dining room had a variety of both western and Asian foods for both breakfast and tea. A shopping mall is right off the hotel with a few nice restaurants and there are others in the surrounding area.. A marvelous singer in the Diplomat Bar who could sing most tunes requested with a talented pianist. Close to Sky Train and taxis always available. Fitness Center facilities were good and attendants attentive. Also, pool on the ground floor next to Fitness Center, and a jogging track on the roof. Try to get a room a with a view of the city. Stunning at night. Quiet with mostly business and diplomatic guests. Close to several embassies. Yes, I would stay there again.
reviews.title: An Awesome Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb rooms and friendly , helpful staff ...Bangkok made easy by the location and the Conrad amenities ...including swimming pool, gym and tennis courts . Restaurants made convenient eating and superb cocktails available .
reviews.title: What a classy experience

reviews.text: This hotel stands for true luxury-helpful and attentive staff, smart accountants at the front desk. Clean and very spacious rooms with careful attention to the small details. Delicious food, perfect ambiente in the Diplomate bar to unwind with good live music perfomances. Nice swimming pool.This hotel fits perfectly for business and luxury trips and stop overs in Bangkok. Access to Skytrain within 5 min. walking distance-even at night without problem.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel industry in Bangkok is very competitive due to the large number of top notch hotels mushrooming in the city. Due to this, while Conrad Bangkok may be considered a great hotel in many cities, this is only a good hotel in Bangkok - in my perspective.
reviews.title: Good but Not Wow....
Quality hotel but poor internet
reviews.text: Generally, the hardwares are in good condition. Room is spacious with functional layout. Bed is comfortable although slightly on the hard side. However, the carpet looks dated and in need for a change. While the wifi signal is strong at the executive lounge and lobby, it is poor to very poor in the room and at many instances, there is no connection at all. This is something that the hotel really needs to look upon.

reviews.title: Everything you want in a hotel stay
reviews.text: While the service is above average to good, generally it lacks the thai warmness and sincerity that I am expecting (comparing to other thai hotels).
Location wise, it is a 5 minutes walk to the nearest BTS station and another 10 minutes walk will take you to Sukhumvit.
reviews.title: Amazing staff, great breakfast, wonderfully appointed room

reviews.text: I thought when i returned to bangkok I will try another hotel other than the usual intercontinental chain. I was really surprised that in a city such as Bangkok, there are so many amazing hotels. Location wise is great, great hotel amenities, clean and amazing rooms and also friendly and helpful staff. From check in till check out I was really impressed with everything. Im sure people out there always want to read a lot more about the hotels, I can guarantee you that this hotel is really an A- grade choice. Great selection of foods as well. Just on its doorsteps is a small shopping mall so you can have access to all amenities that u require. I will definately consider this hotel when i return to Bangkok.
reviews.title: Another great hotel

reviews.text: I did not like this hotel. it is well located but the ambience is just not up to a high standard. Absolutely no natural light unless you are in your room. Very very business orientated. I stayed one night and high tailed it to the Peninsula which was as usual excellent. If you have the money to stay here and are not doing so for purely business reasons you must go to the Peninsula.
reviews.title: Did not like it. Drab.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in mid Dec 07 on our first trip to Bangkok. We use HHonor points as I'm a Diamond member. Upon early arrival (around 9:00am), we were whisked away immediately by a dedicated HHonor staff for an early check-in (per my request when I booked the hotel) directly to our upgraded room on one of the Executive floors. There in our room, the same HHonor staff did our check-in paper work while we rested from a long flight. I've been in many hotels around the world and certainly this kind of service is like no others. Only other hotel in Asia that has similar service that I'd experienced is the Shilla Hotel in Seoul. The room was fantastic. We love the see through bathroom and the rain shower and tub. Our bed was comfortable. Breakfast in the Executive Lounge was amazing! There was quite a few selections. The staffs there were professional and very courteous. The nearest skytrain station is a little far for walking. Luckily, the hotel has a shuttle that goes there and back very frequently. It takes about 5 minutes. For our transportation to the airport, we made use of the hotel's Mercedez S550 for around $90. What amazed us was the fact that, as part of the service, the hotel has dedicated staffs at the airport waiting for us. When we arrived at the airport, a dedicated staff greeted us at curb side. He handled our baggages, took us to our airline and did the check-in for us. Finally, he accompanied us until we got pass immigration. I could not say more about the personal service provided by the hotel. It was truly first class. I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: First class serive like no others

reviews.text: This hotels is something else, we stayed in the residence are, seriously we had a huge suite for 4 of us, it was crazy, huge lounge, with a mental view, two absolutely massive bedrooms, with on suite. Could not fault this hotel at all, the service was too much, breakfast was amazing, sky train a 5 min walk, connected shopping complex, what more could you ask for. The business is quite business orientated, but it did not feel like it at all. Very laid back and relaxed hotel, could not fault one bit......... If your thinking of booking, plsease dont think, just book, and you will not be disappointed. Bangkok is fantastic.........
reviews.title: Next Level Hotel

likes.liked: — The hotel residence rooms, fantastic, and location

reviews.text: I stayed at Conrad for 3 nights on my first trip to Bangkok before moving on to Peninsula Bangkok for next 3 nights, both of which are legitimate 5 star hotels. You can see my review on Peninsula on Tripadvisor as well.
reviews.title: Sleek & Stylish!!

reviews.text: This is a great modern hotel very central in Bangkok. Lets not forget Bangkok is not a nice place so its nice to get back at the end of the day to luxury. Its near business district which is great and is very modern the lobby is great and good views from the room. Only downside was there were some prostitutes in the bar at night which i did not overally like but sadly happens a lot in Thailand so if you ignore this its great.
reviews.title: Nice hotel
Excellent stay - magnificent service made it a very memorable stay!!
reviews.text: Some say the Conrad Bangkok has been built for some years but it is still so well kept! The decor is classic, elegant in a subtle thai style and the atmosphere is so peaceful and serene! Loved every moment of it. The swimming pool was beautiful. The staff was very helpful too!

The stay was not *perfect* as excellent as my comment gets, as on the 2nd night, the entrance roof started leaking with drops of water - but it was then quickly noticed by the cleaning staff and reported to the duty manager ''Frankie and Patrick'' - they upgraded us to the next level up room 'Deluxe Corner room'' with was more spacious and decor mroe classy. Their helpful service and apologetic attitude won our trust and made us feel that we matter :) And not just 'one of their guests'.
reviews.title: Great business hotel but also child friendly
great stay
reviews.text: However I prefer their Classic doubles more than deluxe corner room even though it is one level down due to the see through glass toilet/bath (it is better than it sounds and has a curtain over it should you wish to be invisible) - classic doubles is more cozy and romantic and deluxe corner is more business.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their room service is excellent - try their pad thai and red curry duck - divine.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Had a wonderful Contrad Experience at Conrad Tokyo two years ago, and I looked for another Contrad this time in Bangkok, expectedly, it was an another fantastic Conrad experience. I stayed 32nd executive floor, comfortable bed, convinient bathroom and wonderful rainshower, everything was in the perfect order except I could smell heavy smoke in a non smoking room, they immediately provided air purifier, it got completely normal a day after. Breakfast at 29th floor was a great experience and the entire staff were "great" with a professional service. Hotel staff uniform stand out from other Hotels and they looked sharp and neat and spa facility was the state of the art, clean, quiet with a right temperature. Again the staff were the major memoriable experience, their natural smile and polite manner and willingness to accomadate my needs to ensure my comfort stay at conrad. I just love this place and their Mercedes Benz S550 New Limousine service also made my trip much more pleasant. See you Conrad again!
reviews.title: Impressive, Sleek and Stylish Hotel!

likes.liked: — Room and comfortable bed and shower
likes.disliked: — Lack of Proficiency of Staff English skill

reviews.text: We stayed at the Bangkok Conrad to be near the Australian Embassy to arrange the paperwork for a legal wedding in Thailand, and it was in an ideal location (a tip for US travellers is that the US Embassy is near by as well). Our room was a corner room on a Club Floor which afforded us access to the Club Lounge. The room was beautifully laid out with a table & chairs by the window and a very large bathroom with a big bath also right next to the window. Great views from the lounge, bath or shower. There is also a large walk in robe and a well stocked mini bar. The hotel is a quiet little oasis to retreat to when the busy streets of Bangkok get a bit too much! The breakfast, afternoon tea and canapés served in the Club Lounge each day were consistently varied and of a very high standard. The staff are polished and friendly without being too friendly. We didn’t eat at any of the restaurants as the Club Lounge kept us well fed, however one night we did travel to Sirocco (which is not too far) to enjoy dinner and drinks in their open air restaurant – very memorable. And the shopping in Bangkok was also fantastic… however we were only there for 2 days which wasn’t long enough!
reviews.title: Unassuming & polished

likes.liked: — Either the room itself or the quality of the gorgeous canapes in the Club Lounge
likes.disliked: — It could be a bit businessy for some people - we didn't mind.

reviews.text: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at the Conrad in BKK. Again we were not dissapointed. As a hilton honors gold card member we paid a fee to upgrade to a suite on the executive floor. Cannot find a bad word to say about the place. The staff are all ever so amazing. One day the pool atterndant was on door duty in the main lobby, later that afternoon he was back at the pool ready to deliver you with water and a towel. When we mentioned this he was absolutely astonished that we had recognised him, so unasuming of him and typical of the service given in the Cornard (and indeed other 5 star hotels) I think this is what makes a visit to Thailand so memorable. Would definately stay here again. The breakfasts in the executive lounge were excellent, the afternoon tea and evening cocktails fantastic. A true 5 star hotel and experience.
reviews.title: Amazing suite at the Conrad

reviews.text: Conrad is part of All Seasons Place, conveniently located on Wireless Road. The connection to the mall gives guests a choice of additonal restaurants, and access to a supermarket for supplies.
reviews.title: Great hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also like the location a lot - easier to get to compared to the hotels on the river or on Sukhumvit and Ratchadamri.
reviews.title: Heavenly Conrad

reviews.text: After staying at the Shangri-La on a recent trip to BKK, I moved to the Conrad for a business meeting. The Shangri-La is better but by degrees. The Conrad is better located to shopping and some of the more fun nightlife attractions of Bangkok. The room was nicely sized and the breakfast is good with a lot of variety. The lobby is a little dark which to me always made the place feel cavernous but this is just nitpicking. The pool and gym are nice and the club sandwich I ordered for room service was probably the best club sandwich I ever ate. If I return to BKK it will be a real toss-up between booking the Shangri-La or heading to the Conrad.
reviews.title: Good location, lots to like

reviews.text: Used Hilton Honors reward points for this stay in mid/late April. The hotel is in close proximity to the U.S. Embassy and the entertainment and shopping district (Sukhumvit Rd), with easy access to the BTS (sky train).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly, from the front desk to the doormen. Had executive lounge access which provided an excellent view of downtown in several directions. Lounge size is excellent, plenty of seating and the breakfast items were abundent and plenty of variety.
reviews.title: 10 times at this hotel and looking forward for the next time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pictures of 24th floor king room is included.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you can understand we love this hotel just been there 4-7 april 2012 & 19-21 of same month
reviews.title: An impeccable stop

reviews.text: After 24 hours of travel from the west, we were greeted with smiling faces at the Conrad. At 6:30am we fully expected to have to wait for our room but that was not the case. We were quickly escorted to the club floor where we were promptly checked in and offered fresh coffee while staff handled filling out our registration cards. We stayed on the 29th floor (non-smoking) and found our room to be spacious, well lit, and with a large bathroom that was very well equipped and designed. We were reminded by the bellman that our silk stuffed elephant was a keepsake to take home upon departure. We used the fitness center and found it to be set up with the latest equipment – elliptical machines, treadmills, stationary cycles with various cardio and fat burning programs. There was a fitness manager on duty that was very knowledgeable of the systems, routines, and could speak English. They offered fitness classes of all sorts. The pool was very nice and large. It is situated so it gets some sun to make it warm and there was a poolside bar. We found breakfast to be delightful and while there are limited Asian selections in the executive club, there is an extensive list of choices on the second floor. We stayed three nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay and look forward to coming back again when visiting Bangkok!
reviews.title: The 5 Star City Centerpiece!

reviews.text: The Conrad in Bangkok is a great hotel for American tourists or business travelers. They have wonderful service, excellent desk help and restaurants that allow you to experience Thai cooking or more western meals for the less adventurous eater.
reviews.title: Great Hotel but don't drink the water

reviews.text: My only complaint was that the hotel did not have a sign by the sinks that the water is not potable (had to find it buried in the hotel book) and I did get sick before I realized that was why all the bottles of water are in the room.
reviews.title: Beautiful Well Equipped Apts, Excellent Service, Spotless, Great Breakfast

reviews.text: What can I say, I love the Conrad. Rooms are so beautiful and relaxing, more like little apts equipped with a kitchenette and a huge pampering bathroom. Air condition works well: not to be taken for granted in a city like Bangkok. Breakfast consists of a huge variety of different cuisines and is very tasty. Never tried the outdoor pool, but it seemed lovely from my bedroom window. Lobby is quiet and simply beautiful. In-room dining was the only thing I didn't like: food was awful, but then again, if you're stupid enough to eat in... :-)
reviews.title: Conrad Bangkok Hotel

reviews.text: Free Wi-Fi at the lobby area only. Hotel is a short cab ride from nightlife district (Silom) and adjacent to a mall with fancy western shops, a supermarket and a food court.
reviews.title: A+

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our stay at Conrad, Bangkok. Courteous staff speaking good English, good location within 5-10mins walk to the Sukhumvit Line.
reviews.title: I would come back here if coming back to Bangkok

reviews.text: But we didn't like the breakfast here, it was too western. I mean it tasted good, but we were expecting something 'Thai'.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.text: it's around 10 min walk to the BTS station and free shuttle bus from the hotel to the station. Staff are quite nice and being helpful as almost always the case with the thailand hotel experience.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel itself is linked to a shopping mall ( not very big though) which is quite nice because you get to have the choice not to step outside of the building when it's raining heavily to find the restaurants.
reviews.title: Good hotel, restaurants and staff if great... 2 cockroaches kinda killed it :|

reviews.text: Room is big, nice, quiet and in good condition. comfortable bed with many choice of pillows. i like the bar in the lobby because of the range of the drinks menu and also the ncie food. Live band performance every night that you will enjoy especially after a tiring day with the heat.
reviews.title: Conrad Experience

reviews.text: I am a regular Conrad guest but I must say the experience in Bangkok is always one of the best. The hotel is perfect and the service is great. I can only recommend the Conrad in Bangkok! The rooms are very nice and and the staff is very helpful and attentive. The food is great too.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has always been my number one choice in Bangkok, but my last trip here is encouraging me to consider somewhere else for next time.
reviews.title: Still great but service is slipping

reviews.text: The rooms are still lovely and I do like the location attached to the small All Seasons Place shopping centre, under 10 minutes walk to the BTS. Or you can use the free shuttle bus that runs every 15 minutes if it's too hot or raining. The gym/sauna/steam is very nice and the pool is the best and biggest I've seen in any Bangkok hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the problems, which are all associated with the executive lounge. On every single visit, whether for breakfast, afternoon tea or evening cocktails, I had to wait ages to be offered a drink. And there's no way to get your own drink unless you want coffee, but most of the time I found that there were no clean cups next to the coffee machine anyway. I understand that occupancy was high when I was here, but there were also loads of staff buzzing around. They simply had no structure, no plan, no idea what they were doing. Aside for waiting for drinks, on one morning, four of the six hot breakfast plates were totally empty. I waited and waited for them to be replenished, but even after twenty minutes, only one had been refiled. On two mornings out of five I gave up and went to Starbucks. I don't want to sound too precious, but the poor service made me feel ignored, undervalued, like the hotel really didn't want me as a customer.
reviews.title: Convenient location to all the activities. Top notch services.

reviews.text: Historically, I always loved this hotel and I may well end up back at the Conrad, but for my next trip I will try another hotel. Now that there is a new Hilton Sukhumvit and a Doubletree to open in 2013, I will probably head to one of those.
reviews.title: The Best!

reviews.text: When you're traveling with kids in a foreign country, it's nice to know that there's a reliable hotel like the Conrad waiting there for you. We arrived at 11:30pm on NYE and were in our room, with a full view of the holiday fireworks and a bed made extra for my daughter made up extra on the floor by 11:45. The maintenance man who made up the extra bed went back to the lobby to grab an extra toy Thai elephant for my other daughter, without prompting and with a kind smile. The lounge access was an added cost, but well worth it. Great breakfast, nice views, fabulous coffee, quick checkout and waiters that cater to families with uhm, rambuncious children who were on limited sleep. Great room, great views, great food and of course, fabulous staff. Well done, Conrad.
reviews.title: Quick stopover on NYE

reviews.text: I traveled to Bangkok for the first time on my way to Koh Samui in December of 2012. I used Hilton points and some additional cash for a two night stay.
reviews.title: Wish I Could've Stayed Longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was opulent to say the least ... the additional touches of holiday macaroons, complimentary french pressed coffee and even the stuffed animal gift (an elephant) were welcomed and appreciated. The beds were stiff (that's good) and the the towels were soft. Although I never used free-standing soaking tub, it was quite inviting.
reviews.title: Another great stay at Conrad

reviews.text: Both mornings I didn't take breakfast in the hotel, so cannot speak to that, but I did have two nice long workouts in the 'Bodyworx' facility on sight. It was a full gym with multiple treadmills, barbell and dumbell weights and several nautilus-style machines. I finished one workout poolside with a Happy Hour beverage and a dip in the pool to cool down ... like I said, wish I could've stayed in Bangkok and the Conrad a bit longer to soak up my surroundings.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took a airport limousine from the airport despite everyone telling me to take the BTS/SkyTrain. Only upon leaving, and using the public transpo option, did I discover how truly convenient it is, especially considering the free shuttle from the front door to the station on a few short blocks away.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but...

reviews.text: Stayed here with the family (20,16,12 yr old) and would highly recommend it. It is not in the tourist area but fairly easy to get there (25-30 minutes from the airport). Fare was 1200 baht there and 1500 baht back to the airport (5 people). Strongly suggest that you arrange a tour at the airport. When we booked our taxi after walking out of customs, there were government approved tour operators that can set you up on a promo tour for about 1200 baht. It includes guide and driver. Great deal and then if you like them you can keep rolling into other tours through them.
reviews.title: Excellent, Safe, Incredible Employees, A+ Hilton Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel is what makes it top notch. From the moment we were dropped off, the doormen were very friendly and helpful. The front desk crew was superb. We needed another bed to be comfortable with two rooms and it was delivered very quickly. The Concierge was very helpful and would suggest using them. Thai boxing is not too far away and a great night out.
reviews.title: Thailand Honeymoon

reviews.text: We had access to the Executive Level and would strongly suggest it if possible. The breakfast was great (Western and Asian breakfast items). The afternoon tea and dessert are great. Again the staff attending the Executive Level were great.
reviews.title: Average stay

reviews.text: The hotel is attached to a mall (3+ levels) that has banks (ATMs), food, Starbucks, Burger King, grocery store, shops, etc. Great place if you want something different than what the hotel has to offer for food. There are food places nearby the hotel if you want the local flare and a few legit massage places.
reviews.title: A friendly, accommodating staff and great amenities

reviews.text: The pool and spa are great. Tennis courts are also available and the workout facility is great. The restaurants are good and not too pricey. The bars are good.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: Just wrapped up a 4-day stay in Bangkok with my sister and daughter. Overall, we enjoyed our hotel, Conrad Bangkok.
reviews.title: Overall, a very pleasant stay

reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nicely updated room and public area
reviews.title: Not a 4 or 5 star hotel stay experience!

reviews.text: Very friendly service
reviews.title: Guesthouse ?? Terrible staff !

reviews.text: Great lounge and offerings (breakfast, afternoon tea and evening tapas)
reviews.title: Lost A Bit Since Four Years Ago
Professional, personal service
reviews.text: Stayed here 6 years ago when it was brand new. Hotel is very well maintained, staff very friendly and I think especially two "boss" doormen! Got good service and smiles everywhere however. Especially staff liked our 5 years old boy travelling with us. In this hotel you see hardly any families so during weekdays (we stayed for a week) we felt a little bit like we were strangers there. But anyway the stuff greeted us everywhere that we were welcome to the hotel.

The thing that has changed during these 6 years is that at the pool area you don't get anymore free cold towels nor fruits carried to you every half and hour. And I think that it is a minus in a 5 star hotel! They got free water for you though. Now it's bottled, 6 years ago you got it in glass with ice... That was something six years ago! Wish they get back to fresh fruit service at the pool.
reviews.title: Tasteful Rooms (Especially if you are on Executive Floors) and Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About rooms. As stated in one review before, Classic rooms are just great and I think even better then Corner rooms unless you get corner room with a view. First we were upgraded to a Corner room but once we saw the views and didn't like it we were given a classic room with good views. In that Corner room (was it 2009?) you could see mostly opposite buildings (maybe 90% of the view overall!!!). Then we got Classic room (1901) with much much better view! Rooms **01 - **03 and 24 - **27 has the best views.
reviews.title: Maybe the best hotel I’ve ever stayed in.

reviews.text: As travelling with a child we were not able to have take advantage of executive floor and lounge. Which we did 6 years ago and what I really recommend for anyone staying in this hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding service in a luxury hotel setting

reviews.text: I had a very nice stay at the Conrad for almost two weeks. My room was on the Executive Floor, and it was a corner room, which was fantastic. The room had expansive views of Bangkok, a great tub overlooking the city, and the room was zesty in it's design, not dull. The executive floor lounge on the 29th floor was also great, serving a really nice breakfast, afternoon tea, and evening wine and very good appetizers. And the view is super. The staff at the hotel is great, especially the lobby level staff who always greets you with a warm smile, as do the folks working on the executive floor. We thoroughly enjoyed the Diplomat Bar on the first floor, and the wait staff there was great. Try the "wine buffet," a one hour free pour (well, for about 600 Baht).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and service

reviews.text: The Conrad is a quality hotel located conviently to All Seasons Place (where several multinational companies operate, near US embassy and with a good mall for shopping/food). Rooms are pleasant and equipped well. I found the room WiFi a little unreliable however with a weak signal. On this trip I didn't have any leisure time to use the gym/pool so I cannot comment on their suitability.
reviews.title: Convenient business location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception took great care of us during check in and out. The room was clean, beautifully decorated, well appointed and generally modern. The soaking tub looked out to a fabulous view of the city and the views overall were exceptional. We slept comfortably. There was enough room to spread out and not feel like you are on top of each other. If you want to use the BTS sky train the hotel has a complimentary shuttle that does drop off and pick to minimize walk time. We split our time between two hotels while there and one thing the Conrad didn't do that we wished they did was when a cab picks you up they write down the cab number, company, date and your destination on a business then hand it to you such that if you leave anything in the cab it can be traced. I thought that was a nice touch. With that said, I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Quite pleased. Great location. Generously sized rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked The Conrad Bangkok beforehand at a weekend rate for around 4000 Thai Baht. The main purpose was to sleep over between flights. We expected to find the standard downtown business hotel but eventually our stay exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Modern and classy at the same time

reviews.text: Check-in was swift and efficient. We got an upgrade to an executive room allowing us access to the lounge. The cocktail hour there basically replaced dinner: A large selection of delicious hot and cold finger food. Decent selection of wine and spirits.
reviews.title: Rooms in need of refurbishment

reviews.text: Still pretty jet-lagged, we had a swim in their outdoor pool early in the morning. This is a nice oasis in an otherwise many business focused part of town. Breakfast we had at the Cafe @ 2nd, which offered a good mix of traditional Asian dishes and the usual Americanized bacon-and-eggs cholesterol overdose.
reviews.title: More of a business hotel

reviews.text: The Conrad is an air-conditioned, svelt island of calm in Bangkok's hot, sweaty, smelly, in parts run-doen and hectic city centre.
reviews.title: One of 'the' places to stay at in Bangkok

likes.liked: — Quality and cleanliness as well as everything that you could wish for whilst away from home.

reviews.text: The lobby has a calm, quality feel and rises up to the hotel's restaurants that overlook it.
reviews.title: Always nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff are friendly and welcoming. The room that I had on the 20th floor was an end-room with a little more spare (try for one of these if you can, they are numbered xx07 and xx08 on one side and xx0027 and xx028 at the other.
reviews.title: I enjoyed it but didn't love it

reviews.text: The bedroom is large with an arm chair and small dining table. There is a walk-in wardrobe that few would find fault with.
reviews.title: Worth your money

likes.disliked: — The location, its at embassy row, nothing to see.

reviews.title: A haven in the middle of mayhem!
reviews.text: The bathroom/showerroom/toilet is palacial.

I've stayed here about 5 or 6 times in the past 6 years, and each stay is always better than the last. The staff is top notch, I was picked up from the Air Port, and had an enjoyable ride to the Hotel. Once there, I was able to check in in my room. The rooms are very nice and well decorated. The bathroom is always my favorite! The tub is nice and big, and the shower has a "rain" option in it that I love! The breakfast is one of the main reasons I like to stay there, there's a very big selection of things to eat.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is in walking distance to the local bars, and is up the street from the American Embassy. You're also close to local transportation, so nothing is out of reach. I usually stay on the Executive floor, it offers great views of the area. This is a great hotel to stay at, I highly suggest it. It's a bit pricy but worth it.
reviews.title: courteous and attentive staff

reviews.text: stayed here a couple of months back and I should say as the reviews below state, it is a superb hotel in terms of quality and customer service! though on a bit pricey on the scale, the staff is very friendly and courteous, from the moment we walk in the door to check-in, concierge, security, café and all. in another stay I have with my family, my 1y/o son wearing eyeglasses became an attraction to the staff and it just goes to show that though the hotel is built primarily catering for business travelers, it is also child and family friendly. personal touch and attention to details cannot be questioned. definitely would recommend staying there and looking forward to future visits!
reviews.title: Rate it

reviews.text: I ended up stuck in BKK, worse places to be, for 48 hours.
reviews.title: 3.5 star to be exact....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was only supposed to be there for 1 night, as had a meeting at the hotel, staff where very helpful in extending my stay. Nice clean rooms, nice bar area.
reviews.title: Good service, good location

reviews.text: Just got back from Bangkok and was fortunate enough to stay at the Conrad. Bottom line, best hotel we've ever stayed in. The room was very clean and comfortable, as expected for this level of hotel. The service was much higher than what we expected. From the check-in to the concierge staff, the friendliness and service of the staff was outstanding. They truly made our stay memorable.
reviews.title: Great hotel, superior service

reviews.text: Pros: Superior service, pleasant atmosphere, great room
reviews.title: Best experience in hospitality ever for whole my life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bads: A bit out of the way - no big deal with taxis. Lots of middle-age businessmen with young asian women (my teenagers were old enough to understand).
reviews.title: Meeting the Conrad standard

reviews.text: Tips: If your a Hilton gold member, get an upgrade to the exec floors. Access to the executive lounge was priceless. We spent a lot of time there - from breakfast to drinks in the evening. Using the computers in the lounge to check e-mail was convenient.
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel - Beyond me Expectation

reviews.text: I strongly recommend you to stay in this hotel if you are planning come to Bangkok.

description: One of the world's most exciting and innovative luxury hotels. Located within the stylish All Seasons Place in the heart of Bangkok, and close to the city’s major commercial and shopping centers as well as Lumphini Park. Suvarnabhumi International Airport is just a 40-minute drive away. The Conrad Bangkok fuses luxury and technology, artistry and expertise, and presents guests with cutting-edge design, cuisine and service. Our luxurious guestrooms and suites are furnished with beautiful silk and natural wood giving a sense of contemporary Thailand. With 50 Mbps hi-speed internet access, stay connected in true style.
